titles: A declaration set forth by the Frenche kinge, shewing his pleasure concerning the new troubles in his realme. Translated out of French into English by E.A.
author: France. Sovereign (1574-1589 : Henry III)
Aggas, Edward.
Henry III, King of France, 1551-1589.
publisher: Imprinted by Iohn Wolfe dwelling in Distaffe lane neere the signe of the Castell,
notes: A translation of: Declaration de la volonté du roy sur les nouveaux troubles de ce royaume.

Preceeded on film by fragment detached from another work (with holding stamp of British Library) that begins on E3 and has caption title: A declaration of the causes that haue mooued the Cardinal of Bourbon, the princes, peeres, gentlemen, townes and comminalties Catholike of this realme of Fraunce, to oppose themselues to those which by all meanse do seeke to subuert the Catholike religion and the estate.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: France --  History --  Henry III, 1574-1589 --  Early works to 1800.
